content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. Swimmer’s ear is an infection of the outer ear canal that is typically caused by water remaining in the ear after swimming. A swim instructor will investigate the following claim made in an advertisement for a certain medicated ear drop. Our medicated ear drop is more effective in curing swimmer’s ear than a non-medicated ear drop. The instructor is considering the following two options for the design of a study: Method <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mtext mathvariant="bold">I</mtext></math>: From <math alttext="500" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers who have swimmer’s ear, randomly assign <math alttext="250" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers to a group that will use the medicated ear drop each day and <math alttext="250" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers to a group that will use the non-medicated ear drop each day. Observe the number of people cured in each group after two weeks. Method <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mtext mathvariant="bold">II</mtext></math>: Select <math alttext="250" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers with swimmer’s ear who are currently using the medicated ear drop each day. Select <math alttext="250" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers with swimmer’s ear who are currently using the non-medicated ear drop each day. Observe the number of people cured in each group after two weeks. (a) Give a reason why Method <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is more appropriate than Method <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for investigating the effectiveness of the medicated ear drop. Justify your answer in the context of the problem.
